title: Calories in One Slice of Bacon
meta_description: Discover calories in bacon slice, including fat, protein, sodium, and full nutrition breakdown per slice with cooking tips and variations.
h1: Calories in One Slice of Bacon
assumptions: Standard pork bacon slice (~8 g uncooked weight), pan-fried until crisp, drained of excess fat; no added seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut thickness, cooking method, and fat drainage. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One slice of cooked bacon provides ~43 kcal, mostly from fat, with 3 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in bacon slice?
faqs.a: About 43 kcal for one standard cooked pork bacon slice.
Yes, one slice has ~192 mg sodium, about 8% of daily recommended intake.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in a bacon slice?
faqs.a: Roughly 3.3 g total fat, including 1.1 g saturated fat per slice.
